p: Anti-inflammatory activity was investigated through the production inhibition of NO in RAW264.7 murine macrophage cell line, using prednisolone as reference. Among 16 extracts tested, the ethanolic extract of G. mangostana exhibited the highest anti-inflammatory activity with the IC 50 value of 23.97 ± 0.91 μg/ml. The second and third active extracts were the ethanolic extracts of G. glabra and M. elengi with IC 50 values of 46.35 ± 0.43 and 78.48 ± 4.46 μg/ml, respectively. Other ethanolic extracts and all of the aqueous extracts did not show activity (IC 50 values more than 100 μg/ml). Later, thymoquinone and α-mangostin, the major compound of each plant which passed the criteria of selection ( Figure 1), showed high activity against nitric oxide at the IC 50 values of 1.55 ± 0.14 and 15.15 ± 0.14 μg/ml, respectively, while glycyrrhizin had no activity (IC 50 values more than 100 μg/ml) ( Table 2).
